metadata.title: CVE-2021-38207 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
drivers/net/ethernet/xilinx/ll_temac_main.c in the Linux kernel before5.12.13 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (bufferoverflow and lockup) by sending heavy network traffic for about tenminutes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-81-generic - 5.4.0-81.91
linux-image-5.4.0-81-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-81.91
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-81-generic - 5.4.0-81.91
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-81-lowlatency - 5.4.0-81.91
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1045-kvm - 5.4.0-1045.47
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-81.91').
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11, was pending').
